remark.ch: 學生須自備筆記型電腦

goal.en: Discovering business knowledge from data existing in database or data warehouse is a very important and thriving ways to improve business operations in all industries. The course will introduce some of the most popular and basic algorithms adapted by the industries and academics. The course is designed for students who have basic knowledge of programming and are interested in learning how to derive business from computerized data.
goal.ch: Discovering business knowledge from data existing in database or data warehouse is a very important and thriving ways to improve business operations in all industries. The course will introduce some of the most popular and basic algorithms adapted by the industries and academics. The course is designed for students who have basic knowledge of programming and are interested in learning how to derive business from computerized data.

content.en:
“The course is aimed for business majored students who are interest at applying data analytics method to analyzing business data. Students are expected to learn the methods of major techniques in this area, including classification, clustering, association rules and some statistics-based methods. Besides learning the methods in the class lecture, a TA session is also offered to help students using Python to conduct the analysis. The goal is to equip students with fundamental capability to conduct academic and practical research in business analytics. The capability at least includes the knowledge of applying correct methods for various problems and utilizes the code or slight revise the code of Python to solve the problems.
Programming experience is not required but the knowledge of some programing language is definitely helpful.“
content.ch:
The course is aimed for business majored students who are interest at applying data analytics method to analyzing business data. Students are expected to learn the methods of major techniques in this area, including classification, clustering, association rules and some statistics-based methods. Besides learning the methods in the class lecture, a TA session is also offered to help students using Python to conduct the analysis. The goal is to equip students with fundamental capability to conduct academic and practical research in business analytics. The capability at least includes the knowledge of applying correct methods for various problems and utilizes the code or slight revise the code of Python to solve the problems.
Programming experience is not required but the knowledge of some programing language is definitely helpful.

textbook.en: Textbook Tan, Steinbach, Kumar, Introduction to Data Mining, 2nd edition, Addison Wesley, 2018 Geron, Hands-on Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras ＆ TensorFlow, 2nd edition, O’Reilly, 2019 Reference M. Kantardzic, Data Mining: Concepts, Models, Methods, and Algorithms, Wiley, 2011 Mohammed J. Zaki, Wagner Meira Jr, Data Mining and Analysis: Fundamental Concepts and Algorithms, Cambridge University Press, 2014“

grading.en: Term project 20％ Homework 20％ Midterm exam 30％ Final exam 30％
grading.ch: Term project 20％ Homework 20％ Midterm exam 30％ Final exam 30％

en.Assessments: Presentation/Oral Exam ， Research Report(printed on paper)

ch.competency: 獨立思考和解決問題能力

ch.Assessments: 口頭報告/口試 ， 專題研究報告(書面)

en: Department:Master of Business Administration、PhD in Business Administration only.
ch: 系所:限企業管理學系碩士班、企業管理學系博士班。
